blog.name: luvr4fantanim
blog.title: Musings of little ol'me
blog.description: Be the chaos you want to see in the world -Mollymauk Tealeaf :) 24 year old from Mexico. Slowly dying Astro grad student. Full time Slytherin. ENFP. DnD. Critical Role. Fluent in Spanglish. Stress writer. Adores books, stories and dancing. May or may not be a fangirl in disguise. Keep away from her food. Curses at least once in every fucking paragraph. Ideal job: professional stargazer.

tags: ramblings that have been going on in my head for the last few weeks
summary: My two cents on the Molly discussion
body:
My two cents on the Molly discussion

I’ve been seeing a lot of posts floating around about how people should just accept that Molly is dead and move on and I’m just tired of seeing the discussion pop up on and on and on. While this is simply my opinion on the matter, I don’t think it’s right for people to just shut others down simply because “you just have to accept it” because, (aside from the fact that it’s not a nice thing to do) for a number of reasons, we STILL dont’t know what will happen yet.

1) We’ve yet to see the reactions of the rest of the M9 (Aka Fjord, Yasha and Jester) regarding the death because, at the current moment, they have NO IDEA that this has transpired. Will they go visit the grave, say their goodbyes and leave? Will they push for a resurrection even though it will be exceedingly hard to pull? Will they need a small break after everything that happened to them? How will it change their character? There’s so many unanswered questions about their reactions which is why I’m both dreading and am very excited to see this reunion and see what transpired.

2) Caleb, Nott and Beau were still asking around to see if they could find someone to resurrect a friend. I do think that they made the right call in pushing to rescue their friends who are still alive first, but what will they do after? Their mission with the Gentleman would be accomplished. Their friends rescued (hopefully). What happens next? Will they go directly back to Zadash? Will they attempt to convince Ophelia? Will they go searching for a Temple? So many things that they can do!

I think that the aftermath of this story is going to be a very interesting one to see. And it is because these questions haven’t been answered that people still believe that a resurrection could be possible. Will it be hard? Yes. Will it succeed? Maybe, or maybe aspects of Molly’s past will come to light as to why it will not, or maybe it just simply will not.

One of the things that I really like about D&D is that it encapsulates the phrase “if there’s a will, there’s a way”. You can do a lot of things and push for a lot of things if you really, really try. Whether you succeed or not is just simply based on luck of the die, but you can definitely, most certainly try.

It is true that there’s many things that are not going to happen. For one, I don’t believe Clay is there simply to resurrect Molly. I don’t think he CAN. He just happened to be somebody that they found that just so happens to be a cleric and a soft pastel goth. And I find him to be an interesting character to add to the group if that’s what ends up transpiring. Even more, if the M9 decide to move on, I believe that he’ll be one of the key factors in helping the others as they go through their grief about Molly. He just strikes me as that type of person. (Plus he reminds me a lot of Uncle Iroh from ATLA haha)

For me, it’s ok if the cast decide to leave him be. It’s ok if they decide to not push for resurrection anymore. I think that the moment that the characters decide to do that as a whole will also lead to a big shift in their dynamic. And it’s also ok if they try and fail because of plot reasons or because it turns out that he DID crawl out of the grave and is now someone else.

Molly is important to a lot of people. He was an important form of representation to the community and a source of happiness in the group. To me, he was that one character that resonated with me since episode 1 of this campaign and is still very dear to my heart.

His own death had such a big impact in the community because of this! It wasn’t his time to die, we still don’t know a lot about him and a lot of us (including myself) were looking forward to seeing how his relationships in this mismatched group that could/could’ve become his family would be. Even to the cast and the characters of the M9, this is something that had a big impact on them as well. This is the type of character death that I’ve seen in many fandoms that people still mourn over. The type that people will always remember.

Will he actually be back? I don’t know. The odds are against them, time is running out, clerics that powerful are hard to find and maybe there’s something related to his backstory that will impede them in succeeding even if they do try. But if there is a small, exceedingly small, chance that he could be back… I can guarantee that all of us will be fighting for it.

It’s ok if you don’t believe that he’ll be back, but be nice to the ones that do. Sharing different theories and ideas of what will are what makes fandoms interesting and sometimes you have ones that stand at odds with others’. So don’t just simply try to force your own feelings on the matter to others or try to point out why they are wrong. People process these things in different ways: like me, who is simply waiting for the ending of this arc so I can start seeing the route that they end up deciding to take on this matter.

Anyway, that’s my opinion on this, and I mostly did it to sort my own feelings on the matter, and now I’ll be back to writing my crazy ideas that pop in my head instead of just FEELINGS haha

People process these things in different ways: like me, who is simply waiting for the ending of this arc so I can start seeing the route that they end up deciding to take on this matter.

summary: if a tattooed purple tiefling scrambles out of his shallow grave and staggers blindly southward, don’t try and tell me he...
body: if a tattooed purple tiefling scrambles out of his shallow grave and staggers blindly southward, don’t try and tell me he wouldn’t eventually run into a small group of bandits formerly led by a man named Trevor. don’t try and tell me that they wouldn’t still be living a life of crime, even though some of them did honestly try to work (and inevitably got fired for sloppily picking too obvious a pocket). don’t try to tell me that they wouldn’t jump a lonely figure shuffling along the road at dusk, see that it’s molly, and immediately drop their swords, hands in the air, before he’s even opened his mouth to spit at them in infernal. and don’t try to tell me that molly, having had enough time out of the grave for his thoughts to become more tangible and for language to bloom again in his mind, wouldn’t 1) pretend to know exactly who they are and what he is to them, 2) bullshit all of the information about himself and who he was travelling with (including his name) out of them, and then 3) manipulate them into giving him a place in their troupe. don’t try to tell me that he wouldn’t, only a few weeks down the road, become their de facto leader, while still only halfway knowing who he is and what his relationship was to these people. because he is mollymauk tealeaf, and mollymauk tealeaf is 100% that bitch.

reblog.comment: if a tattooed purple tiefling scrambles out of his shallow grave and staggers blindly southward, don’t try and tell me he wouldn’t eventually run into a small group of bandits formerly led by a man named Trevor. don’t try and tell me that they wouldn’t still be living a life of crime, even though some of them did honestly try to work (and inevitably got fired for sloppily picking too obvious a pocket). don’t try to tell me that they wouldn’t jump a lonely figure shuffling along the road at dusk, see that it’s molly, and immediately drop their swords, hands in the air, before he’s even opened his mouth to spit at them in infernal. and don’t try to tell me that molly, having had enough time out of the grave for his thoughts to become more tangible and for language to bloom again in his mind, wouldn’t 1) pretend to know exactly who they are and what he is to them, 2) bullshit all of the information about himself and who he was travelling with (including his name) out of them, and then 3) manipulate them into giving him a place in their troupe. don’t try to tell me that he wouldn’t, only a few weeks down the road, become their de facto leader, while still only halfway knowing who he is and what his relationship was to these people. because he is mollymauk tealeaf, and mollymauk tealeaf is 100% that bitch.

Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

summary: The long and the short of it is that there’s a truly alarming number of people that seem to be genuinely offended that others...
body:
The long and the short of it is that there’s a truly alarming number of people that seem to be genuinely offended that others are really upset over the death of a fictional character and they need to:

1. Sit the fuck down

2. Chill the fuck out

3. Fuck the hell off

4. And, for good measure, fuck off from wherever they fucked off to
